Okay, so rigs in Unreal are quite a bit
different than Maya. Um, this is I tried
to boil this down to like the three most
basic components of like what a control
rig is or what a rig is in Unreal. Uh,
and it's composed of three assets. The
skeleton uh holds the bones in the
skeleton and then it connects to the
skeletal mesh. just holds the skinning
geometry and the uh the weights, the
skin cluster essentially. It also has
materials hooked into it. Um but you can
think of this as like your mesh in your
asset and bones. Then you have the
control rig and it connects to a single
skeletal mesh asset. But what's
interesting about this is is that you
can point it to other skeletal meshes.
Uh this controller contains the puppet,
the rigging controls, the IK, the
constraints. So it's a big container of
just rigging essentially you can think
of.
Okay. So Maya uh you can kind of roughly
think of it as you connect things
together. Um and as you connect things
together they stay connected uh through
the life of that connection. Uh and if
you think like this in Unreal it's
wrong. Uh in control rig that's not
necessarily how things work.
and graphs in Maya show you how things

and this is where, you know, really that

what we call the execution stack. Uh,
this is really powerful because it gives

rigging.
